Tutorial - Action Adventure Game

Importing Player Object

Let's import the player from the GMS2-BackgroundsAndSprites project. If you have not completed it, you can find the player in RPG Controls on GitHub. You are looking to import obj_player and all the sprites associated with it. Make sure you have access to this game object.

Right click on Objects in the Resources folder and right click and select Add Existing and look for the obj_player in the previous project or the github project file above you just downloaded:

Look at the Sprites tab in the Resources folder and see that there is only the one sprite that the object defaults to. It doesn't include all the other sprites that we need for this object. We will import them in a bit.

Go to rm_castle and select the Instances layer and drag obj_gamepad to outside the level and obj_player to the doorway of the castle.

Go to Sprites header in the Resources tab and press Add Existing and select the five missing sprites that the player calls in their script file. It should include spr_player_down, spr_player_right_idle, spr_player_right, spr_player_up_idle and spr_player_up.

Make sure you have all 6 sprites:

Open rm_castle and go to Viewport 0 and make sure Object Following is set to obj_player. Notice that I have already adjusted the Horizontal Border and Vertical Border. Drag a copy of obj_gamepad and put it on the Instances Layer in the room.

Run the game by pressing the Play Button. Move the player around the screen.
